primary_trope.name: extreme_logistics
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Logistics. Belgian Waffle Ride is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: We gave Belgian Waffle Ride the verdict: Technical Monument (Positive). The Icons tier. 81 out of 100. Let me tell you what that really means.
beats.visual: Verdict badge slam + tier badge + avatar
beats.editing_note: Open with verdict like a boxing title card. Avatar with villain energy. Music: ominous build. PROMISE the viewer they'll learn the real story.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap + cognitive dissonance (verdict vs expectation).

beats.label: WHAT THEY TELL YOU
beats.narration: Let's start with what they put on the registration page.
beats.visual: Marketing highlights overlay — strengths as bullet points
beats.editing_note: Read strengths in an exaggerated 'promotional voice.' Avatar side-eyes camera. Bright, clean visuals — this is the 'too good to be true' section. CONTRAST PATTERN: this calm section sets up the burst at 0:50.

strengths: Rewards actual bike riding—handling, equipment selection, technical skill—over pure watts
The 40% DNF rate is a feature, not a bug—validates course design integrity
$50,000+ prize purse attracts WorldTour talent for competitive racing
Technical variety demands constant adaptation and problem-solving
Fourteen years of iteration show in polished production quality

beats.label: WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU
beats.narration: Now for the part the registration page leaves out.
beats.visual: Red flag overlay — weaknesses with warning icons

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Mixed unroad and pavement

beats.editing_note: BURST SEQUENCE at 0:50 transition (pattern interrupt). 5-10 quick cuts: meme reaction, avatar facepalm, red overlay flash, warning sound. Then settle into analysis. Each weakness gets its own visual card + avatar reaction.

weaknesses: Expensive total cost ($1,200-1,800 minimum for most travelers)
40% DNF rate means significant risk of not finishing
Technical sections punish momentary lapses regardless of fitness
Equipment choices genuinely determine outcomes—tire pressure, gearing, bike selection critical
Large field (2,800 riders) creates festival atmosphere but lacks intimate community warmth

beats.label: THE NUMBERS DON'T LIE
beats.narration: Let the numbers do the talking. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Del Mar sits at sea level and the course peaks around 1,500 feet—altitude is irrelevant. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. $250-300 entry is steep for a one-day event. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. SoCal is expensive—hotels in San Marcos/Carlsbad run $150-250/night, plus flying to SAN and rental car costs.
beats.visual: Score cards — lowest 3 dimensions with explanations
beats.editing_note: RE-ENGAGEMENT BEAT — this is the ~2 min mark. Start with the least bad score, escalate to worst. Each score reveal: brief silence (0.5s), then number slams in. Avatar reaction scales with how bad the score is. Von Restorff: visually isolate the worst score (different color, bigger text, longer hold). [RIFF HERE] after the worst score reveal.

beats.label: THE BOTTOM LINE
beats.narration: BWR rewards actual bike riding over pure watts. The 40% DNF rate isn't a bug. it's validation that the course works as designed. If you're purely a power athlete with limited technical skills, this race will expose you. If you can handle varied terrain, choose correct lines, and manage energy across relentless variety, you'll finish. The course doesn't negotiate with training plans. it tests whether you can ride a bike when everything hurts.
beats.editing_note: PAYOFF. Close the open loop from the hook. Avatar delivers final take directly to camera. End ABRUPTLY — never signal 'we're wrapping up.' MrBeast rule: cut to CTA mid-energy.

beats.narration: Full breakdown. All 14 dimensions. Free prep kit. Link in bio.
beats.editing_note: Keep energy up. Don't wind down.
